data.title: Short High Yield Credit To Hedge Your Stocks Portfolio
data.text: After another week of volatile trading in the US stock market, shorting high yield credit might be the best way to hedge your portfolio.  We explain why.

data.title: Oil surges more than 13% on hopes of output deal
data.text: Crude futures surged for a second day on Friday, with both U.S. and Brent contracts posting their largest weekly percentage gains on record due to hopes that a global deal to cut crude supply worldwide will emerge early next week.

data.title: U.S. oil prices climb by nearly 32% for the week
data.text: Oil futures climbed on Friday, with U.S. prices tallying a weekly gain of almost 32%.

data.title: A Window of Opportunity in High Yield
data.text: In the past, we have argued against market timing and have made the case for high yield as a strategic allocation. While this belief still holds true, it is also true that low probability occurrences may present rare opportunities.

data.title: Why Fate Therapeutics Is Trading Higher Today
data.text: Fate Therapeutics Inc (NASDAQ: FATE) shares are trading higher on Friday, after a multi-billion dollar deal with Janssen Biotech to develop cell therapies for the treatment of cancer.

data.title: Gold futures end higher, but see modest weekly fall
data.text: Gold futures ended higher on Friday as a drop in March U.S. employment helped to lift demand for the haven metal.

data.title: Brent crude surges 10% on hopes of oil output deal
data.text: Crude futures surged for a second day on Friday, with benchmark Brent up 10% on hopes that a global deal to cut crude supply worldwide will emerge early next week.

data.title: Equity market rallies as massive fiscal stimulus passes
data.text: Equities rally aggressively Equity market volatility continues as investors, who are now mostly working from home, grapple with the evolution of COVID-19 and government stimulus. After touching its lowest reading since December 2016, on 3/23/2020 the S&P 500 (SPX) rallied aggressively and closed the week up 10.3%.

data.title: Economic Report: U.S. service sector continued to expand in March, ISM says
data.text: The numbers: U.S. services and other non-manufacturing companies reported continued growth in March, but at the slowest pace since August 2016, the Institute for Supply Management said Friday.

data.title: U.S. small banks have processed more than 700 small business relief loans for $2.5 million: Mnuchin
data.text: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Friday that community banks have processed hundreds of small business loans aimed at shoring up the economy amid the global coronavirus pandemic, and sounded a positive note about a new program that lenders have greeted with skepticism.

data.title: Oil jumps another 12% a day after its best day on record as traders expect big production cuts
data.text: Oil prices rose more than 10% on Friday, one day after posting their day in history, on the hope that a production cut deal will soon be reached.

data.title: Oil Price Truce? Brent Futures Jump 10% As OPEC+ Scrambles Urgent Meeting
data.text: Announcement of a crude producers' meeting follows claim by U.S. President Donald Trump that production cuts of "10-15 million barrels" might be on the horizon.

data.title: Brent oil rises above $32 on hopes of output deal
data.text: Benchmark Brent crude oil futures rose as high as $33.05 a barrel on Friday on rising hopes of a new global deal to cut global crude supply.

data.title: Oil prices march higher as OPEC calls for emergency meeting on Monday
data.text: OPEC will meet on Monday with Russia and other oil producers in the hope of agreeing supply cuts and ending a brutal price war.

data.title: Dollar resumes climb as investors bid for safety
data.text: The dollar resumed its climb versus major currencies on Friday as investors once again made safety bids, amid worsening economic fallout from the coronavirus pandemic.

data.title: Brent reverses losses to rise above $30/bbl in early European trading
data.text: Benchmark Brent crude oil futures reversed losses incurred during Asian hours in early European trading on Friday to rise above $30 a barrel, with hopes of a huge global supply cut deal to support prices still alive.

data.title: Dollar consolidates as hopes for quick recovery evaporate
data.text: The dollar edged toward a 2% weekly rise on Friday, boosted by a surge in the oil price and as investors sought safety amid the worsening economic fallout from the coronavirus pandemic.

data.title: Mnuchin says small business rescue loans launch Friday, despite lender confusion
data.text: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said he was pressing ahead with the Friday launch of a $349 billion coronavirus rescue loan program for small businesses despite confusion over last-minute final rules and lenders unprepared to approve applications.

data.title: Asian markets look to follow Wall Street rally as oil surges
data.text: Asian markets on Friday looked to latch onto Wall Street's overnight gains after crude prices notched their biggest one-day surge on record, helping offset concerns about the depth of a global recession.

data.title: Fed balance sheet increases to record $5.86 trillion
data.text: The Federal Reserve's balance sheet increased to a record $5.86 trillion this week and the central bank reported greater use of some of its newly launched liquidity facilities, all part of its efforts to keep markets functioning smoothly amid heightened volatility related to the coronavirus pandemic.

data.title: US Indexes Close Higher Thursday (April 02)
data.text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average closed at 21,413.44 on Thursday with a gain of 469.93 points or 2.24%.

data.title: U.S. markets shrug off record unemployment numbers as tech shares rise
data.text: Despite reports of historic unemployment with roughly 6.6 million Americans filing for unemployment, domestic stocks rose during regular trading today. One day after grim estimates on the potential death toll from the COVID-19 epidemic in the US sent stocks tumbling and amid a continuing economic fallout from the government’s response to slow the spread of […]

data.title: Here's what happened to the stock market on Thursday (April 02)
data.text: Stocks traded in a wide range Thursday as investors weighed a record jump in unemployment claims and a sharp rally in oil prices.

data.title: Dow closes more than 450 points higher on hopes of Russian-Saudi oil output cuts
data.text: Stocks closed higher on Thursday amid hopes that Saudi Arabia and Russia will curtail oil production, providing stability to energy markets roiled by the price war between the two crude exporters.

data.title: Trump touts 'great' Saudi-Russia oil deal to halt price rout, details unclear
data.text: U.S President Donald Trump said on Thursday he had brokered a deal with top crude producers Russia and Saudi Arabia to cut output and arrest an oil price rout amid the global coronavirus pandemic, though details of how the cut would work were unclear.

data.title: U.S. oil prices settle nearly 25% higher; Trump expects a Saudi Arabia-Russia output cut
data.text: Oil futures rallied Thursday, finding support after President Donald Trump tweeted that he spoke to Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, who held a discussion with Russian President Vladimir Putin, and now expects the two major oil producers to announce a production cut of "approximately 10 Million Barrels.

data.title: Oil: Prices soar as Trump talks up huge production cuts and Saudi Arabia calls for OPEC meeting
data.text: Hopes are building for a truce in the brutal oil price war between Saudi Arabia and Russia.

data.title: Gold Futures Trading Update: Breakout Could Target $1740
data.text: Gold Futures “daily” Trading Chart After forming a tradable bottom in March, Gold futures rallied up to test its 2020 highs. Since then, Gold has fallen in a flag-like consolidation, reaching what I think may have been another tradable bottom early this week.

data.title: Fed likely to support municipal-debt, says former New York Fed president
data.text: The Federal Reserve is likely to support municipal debt, said William Dudley, the former president of the New York Federal Reserve, on Thursday.

data.title: Stocks climb as investors digest grim U.S. jobs data
data.text: World equity markets climbed on Thursday on the back of a surge in risky assets like oil, offsetting concerns over an increasing death toll from the coronavirus pandemic that is expected to push the global economy into a recession.

data.title: Active Managers Can Expose Opportunities in Emerging Markets
data.text: With the coronavirus pandemic taking hold of the global markets, it might seem like investors wouldn’t touch emerging markets (EM) with a 10-foot pole. However, EM at its current state can expose opportunities for active managers who are willing to deftly navigate the risk.

data.title: Dollar maintains gains after weeks of rallying
data.text: The U.S. dollar firmed on Thursday but paused its strong rally of recent weeks after the Federal Reserve made it easier for other central banks to swap their currencies for dollars.

data.title: Energy sector leads Europe stocks higher after rough start to second quarter

data.title: Multi-strategy hedge funds outperformed peers as market plunged
data.text: Multi-strategy hedge funds - those that bet on a broad array of markets using teams of traders, leverage and centralized risk management - have flourished as stocks ended their worst three months since the 2008 financial crisis.
